svg:
#mermaid-1769884727186{font-family:"trebuchet ms",verdana,arial,sans-serif;font-size:16px;fill:#000000;}@keyframes edge-animation-frame{from{stroke-dashoffset:0;}}@keyframes dash{to{stroke-dashoffset:0;}}#mermaid-1769884727186 .edge-animation-slow{stroke-dasharray:9,5!important;stroke-dashoffset:900;animation:dash 50s linear infinite;stroke-linecap:round;}#mermaid-1769884727186 .edge-animation-fast{stroke-dasharray:9,5!important;stroke-dashoffset:900;animation:dash 20s linear infinite;stroke-linecap:round;}#mermaid-1769884727186 .error-icon{fill:#552222;}#mermaid-1769884727186 .error-text{fill:#552222;stroke:#552222;}#mermaid-1769884727186 .edge-thickness-normal{stroke-width:1px;}#mermaid-1769884727186 .edge-thickness-thick{stroke-width:3.5px;}#mermaid-1769884727186 .edge-pattern-solid{stroke-dasharray:0;}#mermaid-1769884727186 .edge-thickness-invisible{stroke-width:0;fill:none;}#mermaid-1769884727186 .edge-pattern-dashed{stroke-dasharray:3;}#mermaid-1769884727186 .edge-pattern-dotted{stroke-dasharray:2;}#mermaid-1769884727186 .marker{fill:#666;stroke:#666;}#mermaid-1769884727186 .marker.cross{stroke:#666;}#mermaid-1769884727186 svg{font-family:"trebuchet ms",verdana,arial,sans-serif;font-size:16px;}#mermaid-1769884727186 p{margin:0;}#mermaid-1769884727186 .label{font-family:"trebuchet ms",verdana,arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;}#mermaid-1769884727186 .cluster-label text{fill:#333;}#mermaid-1769884727186 .cluster-label span{color:#333;}#mermaid-1769884727186 .cluster-label span p{background-color:transparent;}#mermaid-1769884727186 .label text,#mermaid-1769884727186 span{fill:#000000;color:#000000;}#mermaid-1769884727186 .node rect,#mermaid-1769884727186 .node circle,#mermaid-1769884727186 .node ellipse,#mermaid-1769884727186 .node polygon,#mermaid-1769884727186 .node path{fill:#eee;stroke:#999;stroke-width:1px;}#mermaid-1769884727186 .rough-node .label text,#mermaid-1769884727186 .node .label text,#mermaid-1769884727186 .image-shape .label,#mermaid-1769884727186 .icon-shape .label{text-anchor:middle;}#mermaid-1769884727186 .node .katex path{fill:#000;stroke:#000;stroke-width:1px;}#mermaid-1769884727186 .rough-node .label,#mermaid-1769884727186 .node .label,#mermaid-1769884727186 .image-shape .label,#mermaid-1769884727186 .icon-shape .label{text-align:center;}#mermaid-1769884727186 .node.clickable{cursor:pointer;}#mermaid-1769884727186 .root .anchor path{fill:#666!important;stroke-width:0;stroke:#666;}#mermaid-1769884727186 .arrowheadPath{fill:#333333;}#mermaid-1769884727186 .edgePath .path{stroke:#666;stroke-width:2.0px;}#mermaid-1769884727186 .flowchart-link{stroke:#666;fill:none;}#mermaid-1769884727186 .edgeLabel{background-color:white;text-align:center;}#mermaid-1769884727186 .edgeLabel p{background-color:white;}#mermaid-1769884727186 .edgeLabel rect{opacity:0.5;background-color:white;fill:white;}#mermaid-1769884727186 .labelBkg{background-color:rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.5);}#mermaid-1769884727186 .cluster rect{fill:hsl(0, 0%, 98.9215686275%);stroke:#707070;stroke-width:1px;}#mermaid-1769884727186 .cluster text{fill:#333;}#mermaid-1769884727186 .cluster span{color:#333;}#mermaid-1769884727186 div.mermaidTooltip{position:absolute;text-align:center;max-width:200px;padding:2px;font-family:"trebuchet ms",verdana,arial,sans-serif;font-size:12px;background:hsl(-160, 0%, 93.3333333333%);border:1px solid #707070;border-radius:2px;pointer-events:none;z-index:100;}#mermaid-1769884727186 .flowchartTitleText{text-anchor:middle;font-size:18px;fill:#000000;}#mermaid-1769884727186 rect.text{fill:none;stroke-width:0;}#mermaid-1769884727186 .icon-shape,#mermaid-1769884727186 .image-shape{background-color:white;text-align:center;}#mermaid-1769884727186 .icon-shape p,#mermaid-1769884727186 .image-shape p{background-color:white;padding:2px;}#mermaid-1769884727186 .icon-shape rect,#mermaid-1769884727186 .image-shape rect{opacity:0.5;background-color:white;fill:white;}#mermaid-1769884727186 .label-icon{display:inline-block;height:1em;overflow:visible;vertical-align:-0.125em;}#mermaid-1769884727186 .node .label-icon path{fill:currentColor;stroke:revert;stroke-width:revert;}#mermaid-1769884727186 :root{--mermaid-font-family:"trebuchet ms",verdana,arial,sans-serif;}
Protocol Field Values (Examples)
Processing Impact
Field Mappings & Differences
IPv6 Header (Fixed 40 bytes)
IPv4 Header (20-60 bytes)
Evolution to
IPv4 Packet Header Fields:

--------------------------------------
- Version(4b) - IHL(4b) - DSCP/ToS(8b) -
----------------------------------------
- Total Length (16 bits) -
----------------------------------------
- Identification (16 bits) -
----------------------------------------
- Flags(3b) - Fragment Offset(13b) -
----------------------------------------
- Time to Live (8b) - Protocol (8b) -
----------------------------------------
- Header Checksum (16 bits) -
----------------------------------------
- Source IP Address (32 bits) -
----------------------------------------
- Destination IP Address (32 bits) -
----------------------------------------
- Options (variable, 0-40 bytes) -
--------------------------------------

Key Characteristics:
• Size: 20 bytes (without options)
• Variable header length (IHL field)
• Header checksum required
• Fragmentation by routers allowed
• Options field (rarely used)
• 32-bit addresses (4 billion addresses)
IPv6 Packet Header Fields:

--------------------------------------
- Version(4b) - Traffic Class(8b) -
----------------------------------------
- Flow Label (20 bits) -
----------------------------------------
- Payload Length (16 bits) -
----------------------------------------
- Next Header (8b) - Hop Limit (8b) -
----------------------------------------
- Source IPv6 Address (128 bits) -
----------------------------------------
- Source IPv6 Address (continued) -
----------------------------------------
- Destination IPv6 Address (128 bits) -
----------------------------------------
- Destination IPv6 Address (continued) -
--------------------------------------

Key Characteristics:
• Size: 40 bytes (fixed, no options)
• Fixed header length (simplified)
• No header checksum (faster processing)
• No router fragmentation (end-to-end only)
• Extension headers (optional)
• 128-bit addresses (340 undecillion)
IPv4 → IPv6 Field Evolution:

Equivalent Fields:
• Version (4 bits) → Version (4 bits)
• DSCP/ToS (8 bits) → Traffic Class (8 bits)
• TTL (8 bits) → Hop Limit (8 bits)
• Protocol (8 bits) → Next Header (8 bits)
• Source/Dest IP (32b) → Source/Dest IP (128b)

Removed in IPv6:
✗ IHL (Header Length) - Fixed length
✗ Identification, Flags, Fragment Offset
✗ Header Checksum - Redundant
✗ Options - Moved to Extension Headers

New in IPv6:
✓ Flow Label - QoS traffic flows
✓ Extension Headers - Modular options
✓ Simplified processing - No checksum
✓ Larger address space - 128-bit
✓ Built-in IPSec support
Router Processing Efficiency:

IPv4 Processing:
• Variable header length (check IHL)
• Calculate/verify checksum (CPU intensive)
• Handle fragmentation at each hop
• Parse variable options field

IPv6 Processing:
• Fixed 40-byte header (predictable)
• No checksum verification needed
• No fragmentation handling
• Extension headers only at destination
• Result: Faster forwarding decisions

Performance Benefits:
→ Reduced router CPU load
→ Higher throughput
→ Simplified hardware design
→ Better scalability
Common Protocol/Next Header Values:

• 1 = ICMP (IPv4) / ICMPv6 (IPv6)
• 6 = TCP (Transmission Control Protocol)
• 17 = UDP (User Datagram Protocol)
• 41 = IPv6 encapsulation (6in4 tunnel)
• 43 = Routing Header (IPv6 extension)
• 44 = Fragment Header (IPv6 extension)
• 50 = ESP (Encapsulating Security Payload)
• 51 = AH (Authentication Header)
• 58 = ICMPv6
• 89 = OSPF (Open Shortest Path First)
• 132 = SCTP (Stream Control Transmission)
